{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3495068,"name":"Nafi","username":"devNafi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/devnafi/{size}/251778_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T21:07:35.584Z","cooked":"

Using some SparkMAX’s and wanted to invert motors, however apparently the setInverted method is deprecated, and the new documentation doesn’t really explain it as far as I’m aware.

some help would be appreciated lol

There have been lots of changes to the RevLib this year. Check out Migrating to REVLib 2025 | REVLib for the official info with examples.

The 2025 REVLib uses a configurator similar to the Phoenix 6 API.

codedocs.revrobotics.com

SparkBaseConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

declaration: package: com.revrobotics.spark.config, class: SparkBaseConfig

You can create a configuration object, set all your desired configurations, and then configure the motor with the configuration.

something like this:

    SparkMax sparkMax = new SparkMax(0, SparkMax.MotorType.kBrushless);

    SparkMaxConfig config = new SparkMaxConfig();
    config.inverted(true);

    sparkMax.configure(config, ResetMode.kResetSafeParameters, PersistMode.kPersistParameters);
